description:
Pros:
+ Docking windows and workspaces are more flexible than tabs or single sessions.
+ Bash command line editing is more text editor like.
+ Handles suspends/reconnects more robustly than other terminals.
+ SFTP is way better than anything else I've used and even includes a code editor and SFTP video player.
+ SFTP file manager has MacOS style columns and tree views.
+ Can sort of be used to develop projects on remote systems.
+ PC, Mac & Linux

Cons:
+ Sometimes takes time to figure out where things are at first.
+ Debugger and project support would be nice for File Manager / Code Editor, so it could completely work as a remote IDE.
summary: My favorite SSH/SFTP client so far
